Day 30 - A map of the #30DayMapChallenge 
I wanted to finish the challenge in a colorful note with a map of fabric used in Africa using {ggpattern}. I want to thank @tjukanov, the #rstats community and particularly @jakub_nowosad
for centralizing all #rspatial submissions. https://t.co/AMxpvw9rsV

Hi Everyone. I'm teaching an #rstats course next quarter. 

One assignment is to have each student write about a #tidyverse function. What it's for and an example.

What are some less known #tidyverse functions that do a job you find useful?

‚ÄºÔ∏èNew version of #rayshader released with 3D polygon support! Add 3D extruded polygons with the `render_polygons()` function simply by passing in an {sf} object. Map a variable to height or use a constant value.

Ex: An exaggerated view of Seattle's skyline.

#rstats #rayrender https://t.co/sPyTuDoDVT

Learn more about the #tidymodels {stacks} package.
Model stacking is an ensembling technique that combines the outputs of many models to generate a new model‚Äîreferred to as an ensemble in this package‚Äîthat generates predictions informed by each of its members
#datascience #rstats https://t.co/bgdh3m1NNC https://t.co/lDeF197lM1

#Rstats  #estatistica #statistics #datascience #dataanalysis #cienciadedados #analisededados

I've just reviewed the most open-sciency Comm & #ica21 paper ever:

- Data shared
- Power-analysis based on SESOI
- Preregistered
- Shared #rstats & #rmarkdown code

Plus: 
- Separation of within & between effects
- Multi-level modeling
- Assumptions tested

Wow. Truly impressed.
